body_html: PyPy only good interface with native code seems to be CFFI, but it is a C <-> Python interface library. Besides being slower than CPython native interface (when running on CPython, of course), it would be too painful to interface with C++ (Python <-> C <-> C++).
body_text: PyPy only good interface with native code seems to be CFFI, but it is a C <-> Python interface library. Besides being slower than CPython native interface (when running on CPython, of course), it would be too painful to interface with C++ (Python <-> C <-> C++).
body: PyPy only good interface with native code seems to be [CFFI](https://cffi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/), but it is a C <-> Python interface library. Besides being slower than CPython native interface (when running on CPython, of course), it would be too painful to interface with C++ (Python <-> C <-> C++).
